metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17742 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Ruby before 2.2.10, 2.3.x before 2.3.7, 2.4.x before 2.4.4, 2.5.x before2.5.1, and 2.6.0-preview1 allows an HTTP Response Splitting attack. Anattacker can inject a crafted key and value into an HTTP response for theHTTP server of WEBrick.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.12
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.12
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.12
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.12
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.12
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.12
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.12
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.12').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10').
jruby: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
